summary: Gothenburg is Sweden's second-largest city, located on the west coast. King Gustavus Adolphus founded it in 1621 as a trading colony with help from Dutch, German, and Scottish allies. Today, it's a major port and home to many students due to its universities. The city is known for hosting large events like the Gothia Cup (football) and the Gothenburg Film Festival. It's also the birthplace of Volvo and is home to other big companies. The city has two airports and offers many music festivals in the summer.
title: Gothenburg
